name: Instance Table
description:
Use the action tag @INSTANCETABLE=form_name in a descriptive text field to include a table showing data from repeat instances of that form.
If project is longitudinal, use @INSTANCETABLE=event_name:form_name to specify the event and form (can be a repeating form or a form in a repeating event).
Other action tags are available for controlling certain properties of the tables and their contents.

action-tags.description: Tag @INSTANCETABLE=form_name in a descriptive text field to include a table showing data from repeat instances of that form.
Ignore this field in instance all tables.
Tag @INSTANCETABLE-LABEL='column header': Provide an alternative column title for the field in all instance tables.
Suppress the "+ Add New" button on data entry forms.
Hide the '#' column containing instance numbers.

Use, for example, @INSTANCETABLE-VARLIST=rptfrmvar3,rptfrmvar1,rptfrmvar6,rptfrm_complete to include only the variables from the repeating form that appear in the comma-separated list. Also sets the order of columns in the table rather (default is the order of fields from the form).
Override default choices for page sizing: specify integer default page size, or -1 for 'All'
Default behaviour is for a wide table to cause its container to grow. Use this tag to get a horizontal scroll-bar instead.

Where you have an instance table on a repeating form that is referencing another repeating form, use @INSTANCETABLE-REF=fieldname to have the instances filtered to show only those where the current instance number is saved in a field on the referenced repeating form. For example, an instance table in a repeating 'Visit' form may be configured to show only instances of the repeating 'Medication' form where the current Visit instance is selected in the visitref field on the Medication form: @INSTANCETABLE @INSTANCETABLE-REF=visitref.
Use @INSTANCETABLE-FILTER='[v]=1' to specify a logic expression to show only instances that match the filter expression.
Use @INSTANCETABLE-ADDBTNLABEL='Button Label' to specify an alternative label for the "Add New Instance" button ("New Medication", "Add new instance" etc.).
Use @INSTANCETABLE-HIDECHOICEVALUES to suppress the display of choice field values and show only choice labels.
Use @INSTANCETABLE-HIDEFORMSTATUS to suppress the display of the form status field in data entry view. (The form status field is always suppressed in survey mode.)
Use @INSTANCETABLE-HIDEFORMINMENU to hide the link to the repeating form in the Data Collection section of the project page menu.

Use @INSTANCETABLE-SORTCOL=n:direction to specify the column index for the default table sort. The index number should be a positive integer, with 1 being the first column (usually the instance number). Direction is optional and can be asc (default) or desc (case-insensitive) for ascending or descending respectively. The default sort in the absence of this tag is on the first column in ascending order, i.e. @INSTANCETABLE-SORTCOL=1:asc]

Use @INSTANCETABLE-PREFILL='repeatingformfield=value' to have fields on new instances pre-filled with the specified value using `fieldname=value` pairs in the URL in a manner similar to survey form field pre-filling. Notes:
  1. If the tag parameter contains piping expressions then values will be piped live - the form containing the instance table need not be saved.
  2. Multiple fields can be pre-filled either by specifying multiple @INSTANCETABLE-PREFILL tags or by specifying a query string-form argument, e.g. @INSTANCETABLE-PREFILL='v1=1&v2=2'.
  3. The data entry form field pre-filling capability is not limited to fields referenced in the tag, but is enabled for all fields and forms project-wide.

project-settings.name:
Allow pre-filling of fields via URL parameters in data entry mode (as for surveys):

Add &varname=value to data entry form URLs to have field varname get the default value value.
Note: this is like using a @DEFAULT action tag on the field: it will work for unsaved forms only.
